answerText: recrystallization [prompt on crystallization][10] After recrystallization, you can collect your solid product using the "vacuum" form of this process, which draws liquids but not solids through a Buchner funnel. Sieving is another type of it.
heading: ACF Regionals |2014 | Chicago A, Columbia A, and VCU | 3 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this technique in which the solid organic product is dissolved at high temperatures, then cooled back down so that it crashes out, leaving impurities in the solution.
